label: Bug-10
title: API validation errors display as [object Object] instead of human-readable messages

properties.description: Two related problems: (1) UI side: When the create-node API returns a Pydantic validation error (HTTP 422), the UI error handler displays '[object Object]' instead of extracting the actual error message from the response body. The error banner just calls toString() on the response JSON object. (2) Server side: The FastAPI/Pydantic error response returns a raw validation detail object like {"detail": [{"type": "string_type", "loc": ["body", "description"], "msg": "Input should be a valid string", "input": null}]} which is technically correct but not user-friendly. The server should catch these and return a cleaner error message.
steps_to_reproduce: Open the Issues-FS UI and click +New to create an issue
Enter a title but leave the description field empty (null)
API returns 422 with Pydantic validation detail: description field 'Input should be a valid string' with input: null
UI displays red error banner showing '[object Object]' instead of the actual validation message
properties.expected_behaviour: UI should parse the Pydantic error response and display something like 'Validation error: Description must be a string (cannot be empty)'. Server should ideally catch null optional fields and either set defaults or return a human-readable error.
properties.actual_behaviour: UI shows '[object Object]' in the error banner. User has no idea what went wrong. Must open browser DevTools Network tab to see the actual error.
fix_needed_in: Issues-FS__Service__UI: Error handler in create-node form should parse response.detail array and extract .msg fields
Issues-FS__Service: API endpoint should handle null description gracefully (default to empty string) or return a cleaner error format
